page.title: 04NEWS NETWORK: ACTON/LAVENHAM
page.content: The area is served by automatic tele- phone equipment situated at Sudbury and Lavenham. Postal services provide one delivery a day although in some cases not until mid-day. Rural postmen are still a valued contact, and manage to maintain a service in all but the most severe weather conditions. Parish noticeboards giving information on local affairs exist in the main settlements of the block but there are none within it. A branch library exists in Lavenham and a mobile van visits nearby population centres. This service is available to the residents of the block. Two large land-holdings have access to farming related computer services.
